task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 117°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent (base and roofline) of the main building to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading.
The heading has shifted to 0° so I need to rotate back toward ~117°SE while keeping an elevated pitch to capture the building’s roofline for height estimation.
To estimate height I need both the ground/base and the roofline in view, so I should tilt slightly upward while staying aimed at the SE building.
The view again snapped to 0° so I must rotate to 117°SE while keeping the upward pitch to frame the building’s top.
To provide a height estimate now, I should stop and output an approximate height based on a typical 2–3 story building scale (about 3–3.5 m per story plus roof).
